entry.title: Data Cleaning and Visualization in Python
entry.summary:
Clean, Describe, and Visualize Data¶

Matt Oehler¶

Table of Contents¶

  1. First Dataset
    • I found a blog post with some of the 'top' general conference quotes. I used beautiful soup to get the speakers, talk title, and text of each quote. Then I used pandas/seaborn to clean up the data and plot speakers by how often they were quoted.

div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,
  div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #66BB6A;
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */

  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}
/*

Original style from softwaremaniacs.org (c) Ivan Sagalaev <Maniac@SoftwareManiacs.Org>
Adapted from GitHub theme

*/
.highlight-base {
  color: #000;
}
.highlight-variable {
  color: #000;
}

}

}

/* apply the same style to codemirror */
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-keyword {

}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-error {

}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-tab {
  background: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAADAAAAAMCAYAAAAkuj5RAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAGFJREFUSMft1LsRQFAQheHPowAKoACx3IgEKtaEHujDjORSgWTH/ZOdnZOcM/sgk/kFFWY0qV8foQwS4MKBCS3qR6ixBJvElOobYAtivseIE120FaowJPN75GMu8j/LfMwNjh4HUpwg4LUAAAAASUVORK5CYII=);
  background-position: right;
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
}
div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.rendered_html :visited {
  text-decoration: underline;
}






.rendered_html h1:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.538em;
}
.rendered_html h2:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.636em;
}
.rendered_html h3:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.777em;
}
.rendered_html h4:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Clean,-Describe,-and-Visualize-Data">Clean, Describe, and Visualize Data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Clean,-Describe,-and-Visualize-Data">¶</a></h1><hr>
<h2 id="Matt-Oehler">Matt Oehler<a class="anchor-link" href="#Matt-Oehler">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Table-of-Contents">Table of Contents<a class="anchor-link" href="#Table-of-Contents">¶</a></h3><ol>
<li><a href="#First-Dataset">First Dataset</a><ul>
<li>I found a blog post with some of the 'top' general conference quotes. I used beautiful soup to get the speakers, talk title, and text of each quote. Then I used pandas/seaborn to clean up the data and plot speakers by how often they were quoted.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><a href="#Second-Dataset">Second Dataset</a><ul>
<li>Employee Satisfaction. This dataset comes from a .txt file. I used pandas to read in, clean, impute missing data, and scale the data. I also made some exploratory plots.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><a href="#Third-Dataset">Third Dataset</a><ul>
<li>Credit Card Customers. This dataset comes from a .csv file. I used pandas to read in and clean the data. I also made some exploratory plots, explored correlation between variables, and made a pivot table to examine features at a more granular level.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>
<p>First we will load in the libraries that will be used for all of the datasets.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#libraries required for all data sets</span>
<span class="c1">#for webscraping and text parsing</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">urllib.request</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">ul3</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">bs4</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">BeautifulSoup</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">re</span> <span class="c1">#regular expressions</span>

<span class="c1">#for data manipulation</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">sklearn.preprocessing</span> <span class="k">import</span>  <span class="n">StandardScaler</span>

<span class="c1">#for visualization</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">seaborn</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">sns</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="First-Dataset">First Dataset<a class="anchor-link" href="#First-Dataset">¶</a></h2><h3 id="General-Conference-Quotes-(from-the-web)">General Conference Quotes (from the web)<a class="anchor-link" href="#General-Conference-Quotes-(from-the-web)">¶</a></h3><hr>
<h3 id="Goal:">Goal:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Goal:">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>Get a list of inspirational quotes from LDS general conference</li>
<li><p>Here is the <a href="https://www.templesquare.com/blog/top-april-2018-general-conference-quote">blog post</a> of the 'best' quotes from the April 2018 General Conference.</p>
</li>
<li><p>Based on the following passage at the beginning of the blog post, I figured it wouldn't be unethical to scrape the data for this assignment.</p>
<ul>
<li>'Keep special messages from April 2018 General Conference in your minds and hearts with these conference quote designs. You can share them on social media or just save the images to view time and time again. We hope these help you to continue to feel inspiration from LDS Church leaders and the sweet spirit in which they initially gave these messages.'</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#specify the url</span>
<span class="n">quote_page</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'https://www.templesquare.com/blog/top-april-2018-general-conference-quote'</span>

<span class="c1">#query the website and return the html to the variable 'page'</span>
<span class="n">page</span>  <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ul3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">urlopen</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">quote_page</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#parse the html using beautiful soup and store in variable 'soup'</span>
<span class="n">soup</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">BeautifulSoup</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">page</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'html.parser'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># get a preview of the raw html</span>
<span class="c1"># soup</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>After examining the HTML I found that the quote data that I'm interested in are contained in the <p> tags.
The following code is used to extract the text that I want.</p>
</p></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Take out the <div> of name and get its value</span>
<span class="n">name_box</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">soup</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">find_all</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'p'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#preview of the <p> tags we extracted</span>
<span class="c1">#we can see that we got the quotes, but we got other unwanted information as well</span>
<span class="c1">#the next cell shows it in a more readable style</span>
<span class="n">name_box</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[5]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>[<p class="site-title" itemprop="headline">
 <a href="https://www.templesquare.com/">Temple Square</a>
 </p>,
 <p class="entry-meta"><time class="entry-time" datetime="2018-04-07T19:16:08+00:00" itemprop="datePublished">April 7, 2018</time></p>,
 <p>Keep special messages from April 2018 General Conference in your minds and hearts with these conference quote designs. You can share them on social media or just save the images to view time and time again. We hope these help you to continue to feel inspiration from LDS Church leaders and the sweet spirit in which they initially gave these messages.</p>,
 <p> </p>,
 <p><a href="https://www.lds.org/general-conference/2018/04/precious-gifts-from-god?lang=eng"><b>Precious Gifts from God</b></a><b> | M. Russell Ballard</b></p>,
 <p>“If we have faith as small as a mustard seed, the Lord can help us remove the mountains of discouragement and doubt in the tasks ahead of us as we serve with God’s children.”</p>,
 <p>“Life can be filled with faith, joy, happiness, hope, and love when we exercise the smallest amount of real faith in Christ, even a mustard seed of faith.”</p>,
 <p><a href="https://www.templesquare.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Quotes-Sp2018-Conf-01.jpg" rel="attachment wp-att-22645"><img alt="Best April 2018 General Conference Quotes - M. Russell Ballard" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-22645" data-jpibfi-post-excerpt="" data-jpibfi-post-title="Top April 2018 General Conference Quotes" data-jpibfi-post-url="https://www.templesquare.com/blog/top-april-2018-general-conference-quotes/" data-jpibfi-src="https://www.templesquare.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Quotes-Sp2018-Conf-01.jpg" height="431" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px" src="https://www.templesquare.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Quotes-Sp2018-Conf-01.jpg" srcset="https://www.templesquare.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Quotes-Sp2018-Conf-01.jpg 600w, https://www.templesquare.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Quotes-Sp2018-Conf-01-300x216.jpg 300w, https://www.templesquare.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Quotes-Sp2018-Conf-01-20x14.jpg 20w" width="600" /></a></p>,
 <p> </p>,
 <p><a href="https://www.lds.org/general-conference/2018/04/am-i-a-child-of-god?lang=eng"><b>Am I a Child of God?</b></a><b> | Brian K. Taylor</b></p>]</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># this is a cleaner way to preview what we extracted but the output is still very long</span>
<span class="c1"># counter = 0</span>
<span class="c1"># for i in name_box:</span>
<span class="c1">#     counter += 1</span>
<span class="c1">#     print(counter)</span>
<span class="c1">#     print(i.text.strip())</span>
    
<span class="c1"># # print(name_box[0].text)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The next several code chunks go through and clean up the text so that we can get an organized, clean data frame of the conference quotes.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#make an array that contains all the quotes</span>
<span class="n">all_quotes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="c1">#the conditions help to filter out the blanks and some of the junk</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">name_box</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strip</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strip</span><span class="p">())</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">all_quotes</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strip</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#after inspection we need to </span>
<span class="c1">#truncate the ends to drop unwanted intro/conclusion remarks from blogger</span>
<span class="n">aq_clean</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">all_quotes</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="c1"># aq_clean</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># general cleaning of the data</span>

<span class="c1">#drop blank entries</span>
<span class="c1">#add titles and speakers to a list</span>
<span class="c1">#add quotes to a list</span>

<span class="c1">#lists talks speakers and quotes</span>
<span class="n">talks_and_speakers</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span> <span class="c1">#this will be split up later</span>
<span class="n">just_quotes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">aq_clean</span><span class="p">)):</span>
<span class="c1">#     print(i)</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="s1">'|'</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">aq_clean</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]:</span>
        <span class="n">current_talk_speaker</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">aq_clean</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">current_quote</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">aq_clean</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="n">just_quotes</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">current_quote</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">talks_and_speakers</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">current_talk_speaker</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#verify that lists of quotes and speakers are the same length        </span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">talks_and_speakers</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">just_quotes</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>55
55
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>After throwing what we have so far into a pandas dataframe we can see that it's pretty clean, but there are still a few things we can do to make it even better.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#after throwing what we have so far into a pandas dataframe we can see that it's pretty clean, but </span>
<span class="n">df_raw</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'TS'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">talks_and_speakers</span><span class="p">,</span>
                       <span class="s1">'Quote'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">just_quotes</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df_raw</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">df_raw</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1">#now lets clean this up a little bit with pandas</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>(55, 2)
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[10]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#then split apart talk and speaker into two separate columns</span>
<span class="c1">#split up talk and speaker into separate columns</span>
<span class="n">df_raw</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Talk'</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">df_raw</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Speaker'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df_raw</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'TS'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'|'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span>

<span class="c1">#rename test to Quotes</span>
<span class="c1"># df_raw = df_raw.rename(index = str,columns={'test': 'Quotes'})</span>
<span class="n">df_clean</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df_raw</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">"TS"</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)[[</span><span class="s1">'Speaker'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'Talk'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'Quote'</span><span class="p">]]</span>
<span class="c1"># df_raw.head()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df_clean</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">df_clean</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="BOOM!-Now-we-have-some-clean-data-that-we-can-work-with">BOOM! Now we have some clean data that we can work with<a class="anchor-link" href="#BOOM!-Now-we-have-some-clean-data-that-we-can-work-with">¶</a></h3><h4 id="Now-let's-do-some-simple-EDA">Now let's do some simple EDA<a class="anchor-link" href="#Now-let's-do-some-simple-EDA">¶</a></h4><p>Does this blog have a particular bias towards any speaker? (i.e. do they quote someone more often than others?)</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#use seaborn library to make plot of speaker frequency</span>
<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">countplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df_clean</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Speaker</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xticklabels</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_xticklabels</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="n">rotation</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">90</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">g</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">despine</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
">
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I decided to make a simple plot of how often each speaker was quoted on this blog. We can see that Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf of the Quorum of the 12 Apostles was the most popular speaker according to this blog (It probably has something to do with his amazing German accent!). This is interesting especially when you account for the fact that he only spoke once, while others (namely those is the first presidency) gave multiple talks.</p>
<p>Next I decided to look and see if there were any particular words that were used more often than others (excluding filler words such as: the, and, or, of, a, an, etc).</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#remove punctuation and special characters</span>
<span class="n">raw_quotes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df_clean</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Quote</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'[^\w\s]'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#cast to a list and then combine into one giant string</span>
<span class="n">raw_quote_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">raw_quotes</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">all_words</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">" "</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">raw_quote_list</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#make all lower case and then split up by individual words</span>
<span class="n">all_words</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">all_words</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lower</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># all_words #output is super long</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#import counter to make count of all the words</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">collections</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Counter</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#look at top 30 most popular words</span>
<span class="n">word_counts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Counter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">all_words</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">word_counts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">most_common</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[16]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>[('the', 68),
 ('to', 64),
 ('of', 53),
 ('and', 50),
 ('our', 35),
 ('we', 33),
 ('in', 24),
 ('that', 24),
 ('us', 20),
 ('a', 19),
 ('you', 16),
 ('is', 16),
 ('be', 14),
 ('are', 14),
 ('as', 13),
 ('his', 13),
 ('i', 13),
 ('will', 12),
 ('have', 11),
 ('can', 11),
 ('not', 11),
 ('with', 9),
 ('all', 9),
 ('when', 8),
 ('christ', 8),
 ('for', 8),
 ('god', 7),
 ('know', 7),
 ('one', 7),
 ('need', 7)]</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#after spot checking the most common words it seems that the filler words start to drop out around 9 (usage frequency)</span>
<span class="c1">#I also added a lower threshold at 3 since I wouldn't really consider a word popular if it wasn't quoted at least 3 times</span>
<span class="n">non_fillers</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">pair</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">pair</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">word_counts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">most_common</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">pair</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><</span><span class="mi">9</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="n">pair</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">>=</span><span class="mi">3</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pair</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">></span><span class="mi">2</span> <span class="p">]</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">non_fillers</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># print(non_fillers)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>('when', 8)
('christ', 8)
('for', 8)
('god', 7)
('know', 7)
('one', 7)
('need', 7)
('lord', 6)
('love', 6)
('but', 6)
('him', 6)
('together', 6)
('they', 6)
('faith', 5)

('others', 5)

('life', 4)

('peace', 4)
('gift', 4)
('jesus', 4)

('because', 4)
('ghost', 4)

('atonement', 4)
('spiritual', 4)
('small', 3)
('gods', 3)
('happiness', 3)
('your', 3)

('come', 3)
('never', 3)
('father', 3)
('hearts', 3)

('strengthening', 3)
('heavenly', 3)
('who', 3)

</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#then I unzipped the result to get the lists of words and counts, but I mostly just want to look at the words</span>
<span class="n">a</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">b</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">zip</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">non_fillers</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">a</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># print(b)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>('when', 'christ', 'for', 'god', 'know', 'one', 'need', 'lord', 'love', 'but', 'him', 'together', 'they', 'faith', 'spirit', 'day', 'things', 'through', 'others', 'each', 'holy', 'children', 'life', 'even', 'from', 'failure', 'peace', 'gift', 'jesus', 'live', 'other', 'service', 'because', 'ghost', 'what', 'atonement', 'spiritual', 'small', 'gods', 'happiness', 'your', 'feel', 'come', 'never', 'father', 'hearts', 'true', 'strengthening', 'heavenly', 'who', 'promise', 'protect', 'them', 'sacrifice', 'follow', 'time', 'more', 'faithful', 'like', 'out', 'think', 'has', 'see', 'find', 'may', 'only', 'simple', 'saviors', 'eternal', 'meet')
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Even in this reduced list there are still many filler words, but we can see that words such as: Christ, Atonement, God, Faith, Happiness, etc. It isn't surprising to find words like this, given that the corpus is just a list of general conference quotes. I think it would be interesting though to expand this idea and apply it to all of the conference talks instead of just some of the main quotes. Then we could see if there were common themes or subjects throughout all of the sessions.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Second-Dataset">Second Dataset<a class="anchor-link" href="#Second-Dataset">¶</a></h2><h3 id="Employee-Satisfaction-(.txt-file)">Employee Satisfaction (.txt file)<a class="anchor-link" href="#Employee-Satisfaction-(.txt-file)">¶</a></h3><hr>
<h4 id="Dataset-Details">Dataset Details<a class="anchor-link" href="#Dataset-Details">¶</a></h4><p>In order for companies to be economically productive, they will want to maximize their profits. One factor
that influences a company’s profits is its employees. Employees that are active and engaged help to yield
higher profits while unmotivated and unhappy employees do not. As a result, companies are interested in
how happiness, as well as other possible factors, contribute to an employee’s performance. Knowing those
relationships will help companies to enact policies or make changes in company culture that will maximize
employee performance, and help to increase company profits.
To perform this analysis, researches gathered data on 480 university employees. The data includes measurements
on variables including: age, number of years employed, the employees well-being, the employee’s
satisfaction with their job, the employee’s IQ, and the employee’s job performance. Using these data, one
should be able to model how the other features impact an employee’s job performance.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Goals:">Goals:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Goals:">¶</a></h4><ul>
<li>Read in the dataset dealing with employee satisfaction (it comes from a .txt file)</li>
<li>Fill in missing values appropraitely</li>
<li>Do some exploratory analysis and visualizations to see if there is insight that can be easily extacted</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#read in the data</span>
<span class="n">dat</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'employee.txt'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">delim_whitespace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>(480, 7)
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[19]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>So after reading in the data and printing out a simple summary, we can take note of a few things:</p>
<ul>
<li>The dataset consists of 7 features: ID, Age, Tenure, WellBeing, JobSat, JobPerf, and IQ</li>
<li>Based on the count row in the summary, we can see that the columns for WellBeing, JobSat, and JobPerf have missing values</li>
<li>Since ID is just an index it doesn't provide any insight for us. We will just drop this column.</li>
</ul>
<p>Before filling in the missing values, let's take a look to see if the data are missing at random, or if there is a pattern to the missingness. Additionally, we will look at the data to see if there are any notable correlations, distributions, or anomalies.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#drop ID column</span>
<span class="n">dat</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'ID'</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#how many observations out of 480 are incomplete</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Observations with missing values: "</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="kc">True</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">idx</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iterrows</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">any</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">())]))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Total Observations: "</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="c1">#plot of missing values</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">heatmap</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(),</span><span class="n">cbar</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Plot of Missing Values"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Index'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">13</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">despine</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Observations with missing values:  349
Total Observations:  480
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
">
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#make a pairs plot that shows scatter plots of all combinations of variables as well</span>
<span class="c1">#as distributions (via histogram) of each variable along the diagonal</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pairplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dropna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">how</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'any'</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">despine</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
">
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From this plot we can see that there is some correlation between Age and Tenure, and also between WellBeing and JobPerf (which is consistent with intuition). It should also be noted that most of the variables seem to be approximately normally distributed.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># fill in missing values with mean or median</span>
<span class="c1"># or if I'm feeling ammbitious try to implement multiple stochasitc regression imputation</span>
<span class="c1"># or some other kind of regression imputation</span>

<span class="c1">#explore the correltations that I mentioned or for the data set as a whole</span>

<span class="c1">#do something based on the AV blog for pandas tips</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># for now lets fill missing values with median</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">median_fill</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">filler</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'median'</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">'''function takes a pandas dataframe, and fills missing values with the median</span>
<span class="sd">    '''</span> 
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">dataset</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">dat</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fillna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dat</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">median</span><span class="p">(),</span><span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># dat.Age.median()</span>
<span class="n">median_fill</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dat</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see that this method is sub-optimal becuase it makes spikes in the distributions of the columns that had missing data (WellBeing, JobSat, and JobPerf).</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#we can see that this method is sub-optimal becuase it makes spikes in the distributions</span>
<span class="c1">#of the columns that had missing data</span>
<span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">hist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xlabelsize</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1">#plot of missing values</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">heatmap</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(),</span><span class="n">cbar</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Plot of Missing Values"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">despine</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
">
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
">
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>A better method to fill in the missing values would be to use the data that we do have to predict the observations that we don't have. I'm still a python novice, and so I didn't go that route this time, but it's important to note that it would probably be a better option if we wanted to do a more in-depth analysis of the data.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">quantile</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">25</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">75</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[28]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped="">
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>Age</th>
<th>Tenure</th>
<th>WellBeing</th>
<th>JobSat</th>
<th>JobPerf</th>
<th>IQ</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0.25</th>
<td>34.0</td>
<td>8.0</td>
<td>5.870</td>
<td>5.560</td>
<td>5.4275</td>
<td>94.515</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>0.75</th>
<td>42.0</td>
<td>12.0</td>
<td>6.665</td>
<td>6.265</td>
<td>6.7450</td>
<td>105.515</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">dat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Boxplots for Employee Data"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
">
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The boxplots and quantiles above help us to see that the scale of the variables isn't really consistent across the board. This would make it difficult to compare coefficients if we decided to make a regression model. To handle this we can perform standard scaling operations on the dataset.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">standard</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">StandardScaler</span><span class="p">()</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Third-Dataset">Third Dataset<a class="anchor-link" href="#Third-Dataset">¶</a></h2><h3 id="Credit-Card-Dataset-(.csv-file)">Credit Card Dataset (.csv file)<a class="anchor-link" href="#Credit-Card-Dataset-(.csv-file)">¶</a></h3><hr>
<h3 id="Data-Summary:">Data Summary:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Data-Summary:">¶</a></h3><p>Credit card companies, like any other company, want to be profitable. In order to maximize their profits, a company wants to maximize the amount of card holders that have a moderate monthly balance, and minimize the amount of customers that have a large monthly balance. This dataset, which contains the demographics and current balance of card holders, could be used to a) determine if there is a relationship between certain demographics of card holders and their current balance and b) create a model to predict a potential card holder's balance so that the company can make a better decision about issuing that person a credit card.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [31]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#read in the data and verify</span>
<span class="n">credit</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'creditdata.csv'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">credit</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">credit</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">

</pre>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have 294 observations of 11 different variables for credit card customers. There aren't any missing values, and</p>
<p>To start off the data exploration I created a pairs plot that shows the scatter plots for all quantitative variables in the data set. These variables include: income, credit limit, credit rating, number of credit cards, age, years of education and current balance. We can see right off the bat that credit limit and credit rating are very highly correlated, and there appear to be some other correlations as well, all of which  can be seen in the correlation matrix that follows.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [33]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pairplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">credit</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">despine</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
">
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Next I made box plots to see if any of the categorical variables might have an apparent affect on credit card balance. From these boxplots it seems like student status has the biggest effect on balance.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [35]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Balance'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Gender'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">credit</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Balance'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Student'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">credit</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Balance'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Married'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">credit</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Balance'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Ethnicity'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">credit</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Then I made a pivot table to look at average balance for the different categories. It seems like married/Caucasian student along with single/Asian students have the highest credit balance on average.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [36]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pivot_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">credit</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">values</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Balance'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Ethnicity'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'Student'</span><span class="p">],</span> 
               <span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Married'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">aggfunc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

entry.title: Simple Linear Regression
entry.summary:
Simple Linear Regression¶

Car Weight & Mileage¶

Although it is relatively simple compared to many modern data analysis techniques, linear regression is an incredibly useful tool. Let's walk through a simple example together, using data to model the mileage of a car based on its weight.

Setup¶

We'll start by importing some of the basic libraries used for data analysis.

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Simple-Linear-Regression">Simple Linear Regression<a class="anchor-link" href="#Simple-Linear-Regression">¶</a></h1><h2 id="Car-Weight-&-Mileage">Car Weight & Mileage<a class="anchor-link" href="#Car-Weight-&-Mileage">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Although it is relatively simple compared to many modern data analysis techniques, linear regression is an incredibly useful tool. Let's walk through a simple example together, using data to model the mileage of a car based on its weight.</p>
<h3 id="Setup">Setup<a class="anchor-link" href="#Setup">¶</a></h3><p>We'll start by importing some of the basic libraries used for data analysis.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#import basic libraries</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">seaborn</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">sns</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="o">%</span><span class="k">matplotlib</span> inline
<span class="o">%</span><span class="k">config</span> InlineBackend.figure_format = 'retina'
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Explore/Visualize-the-Data">Explore/Visualize the Data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Explore/Visualize-the-Data">¶</a></h3><p>Next we'll load the data.</p>
<p>You can find the data <a href="https://github.com/mjoehler94/Side-Projects/blob/master/SLR_mpg/MPGData.txt">here</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#load data and look at first few values.</span>
<span class="n">car_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'MPGData.txt'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">delimiter</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Dimensions: '</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">car_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">car_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Dimensions:  (289, 2)
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[19]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">

<th></th>
<th>Weight</th>
<th>MPG</th>
</tr>

<td>3436</td>
<td>18.0</td>
</tr>

<td>16.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td>3449</td>
<td>17.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>3086</td>
<td>14.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td>24.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>5</th>
<td>2833</td>
<td>22.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>6</th>
<td>2774</td>
<td>18.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>7</th>
<td>2587</td>
<td>21.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>8</th>
<td>2130</td>
<td>27.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>9</th>
<td>1835</td>
<td>26.0</td>

</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Looks like we read in the data successfully!</p>
<p>Let's explore the data a little bit with a simple scatter plot. If the data appear to have a linear relationship, then we should be able to proceed using simple linear regression.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#visualize data</span>
<span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">=</span>  <span class="n">car_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'MPG'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1">#we'll use the weight of the cars as our X variable</span>
<span class="n">Y</span> <span class="o">=</span>  <span class="n">car_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">MPG</span> <span class="c1">#we'll use the mileage of the car as our Y variable</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scatter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Car Weight'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Mileage'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
